noThisInStatic.description:
Description

Disallowthisandsuperinstaticcontexts.
In JavaScript, thethiskeyword in static contexts refers to the class (the constructor) instance,
not an instance of the class. This can be confusing for developers coming from other languages wherethistypically refers to an instance of the class, not the class itself.
Similarly,superin static contexts refers to the parent class, not an instance of the class.
This can lead to unexpected behavior if not properly understood.
This rule enforces the use of the class name itself to access static methods,
which can make the code clearer and less prone to errors. It helps to prevent
misunderstandings and bugs that can arise from the unique behavior ofthisandsuperin static contexts.
noThisInStatic.option: This rule has no specific options.
